intro: Pedicularis longistipitata, commonly known as the long-stemmed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic growth habit. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in alpine environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological niche, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
